question_text: In a PoE deployment, what could occur if a cable run exceeds the standard Ethernet length limit of 100 meters?
answer_options: The device will switch to a lower power class automatically
The data connection will remain stable, but power delivery will fail
Both power and data transmission may degrade or fail
PoE switches compensate automatically beyond 100 meters
correct_answer: Both power and data transmission may degrade or fail
explanation: Exceeding the 100-meter Ethernet limit can introduce voltage drop and signal degradation, affecting both power and data integrity in a PoE setup.
